alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Indiana; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 2:10PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL INDIANA...EAST CENTRAL ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHEASTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Murrysville, or near Monroeville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Indiana, Apollo, Plum, Murrysville, North Versailles, Pitcairn, Trafford, Delmont, North Apollo, Avonmore, and Orchard Hills. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 56 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Pennsylvania.
